New_Britain.Connecticut School of Broadcasting:
The Connecticut School of Broadcasting is a national career college that trains students for careers on-air and/or behind-the-scenes in New Media, Audio/Video Production, Television and Radio. The school has eleven campuses in MA, CT, NJ, NY, NC, GA and FL of the United States.


== Overview ==
Founded in 1964 by Dick Robinson as a small, private school in Connecticut, offering classes in TV and radio broadcasting, as well as digital media.
